title: (x) Credits on Apocalypse Now movie poster - Lightline Gothic {Mark S}
content:
[http://www.alyon.org/generale/theatre/cinema/affiches\_cinema/a/am-ar/apocalypse\_now.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060521164152/http:/www.alyon.org/generale/theatre/cinema/affiches_cinema/a/am-ar/apocalypse_now.jpg)

This is the movie poster for Apocalypse Now. Can anyone indentify the type used for the credits at the bottom?
author: Giordano

comments.content: Lightline Gothic. I don’t know of a digital version, but a light weight of News Gothic or Trade Gothic would be close. The most noticeable difference will be the capital M.

Oh wait, there’s another one…

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/lightline-gothic-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060521164152/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/lightline-gothic-mt/)

is this the same?

There’s also one by Veer…

[http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000250](http://web.archive.org/web/20060521164152/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000250)

do you think any one is better than the others (more tru to the original?) or does it really matter?
D’oh! I should have checked first. Yeah, that’s it. (And that, and that.)
